Title: LaPlata Canyon Hike
Description: We will drive as far as we can depending on the road condition for a moderate hike up another 3-4 miles on a 4WD road or amtnætrail if we can get to the top.

Title: Butler Wash and Bullet Canyon Camping Trip
Description: We will drive to Butler Wash and set up a car camp. Then explore the side canyons with ruins.æOn the second or third day, we will drive over to Cedar Mesa to hike Bullet Canyon down to Perfect Kiva and Jailhouse Ruin.æ

Title: Horse Gulch
Description: From the trailhead we go up the road until the sign post.æ Then we shall take the Meadowæloop,æpast the Telegraph trail intersection and then to the intersection with Stacey's loop.æ We will follow Stacy's till it rejoins the Meadow loop at which point we will continue on the meadow loop to the road and then back to the trailhead.ææ

Title: Hike Twin Buttes Trail And Trail TowardsæPerinsæPeak with Option To Climb Larger Butte
Description: We will start at the trailhead located at the Animas High School parking lot. The trail brings us to a junction that goes towardsæPerinsæPeak and then coming out on the trail that brings us to the base of the larger butte with an option to climb. To return we will continue along the trail that goes around the Twin Buttes and then meets up with the starting trail.

Title: Hike Alien Run Trail
Description: This is a relatively flat trail near Aztec with desert views, slick rock, alien crash site, and P&J forest.ææDQ on the return.æ

Title: SO! General Meeting: Slot Canyons in Utah by Chris Blackshear
Description: The sandstone canyons of Utah are some of the most fascinating geography on earth.ææThe talk will feature lots of photographs of canyons and will highlight some of the more accessible ones, all within a day's drive of Durango.

Title: New Mexico ARec Centerhes Hike
Description: Hike to Anasazi and Octopus aRec Centerhes in Northern New Mexico. It is not farætoæeither aRec Centerh, but there will be some scrambling and it is all off-trail bushwhacking. We can extend the outing by exploring the areas surrounding both aRec Centerhes.

Title: Fort Lewis Loop Trail
Description: Hike begins at Centennial Nature Trail lower trail head atæjctæ.of E 10th St & E 6th AV and ends at E 12th ST and 12th ST Place (between E 4th AV & E 5th AV, a half block East of the Mason Center and tennis courts on E 3rd AV). Park on street between the start and finish _ three blocks apart. The trail switchbacks up to the FLC campus, ciRec Centerumnavigates the college campus in the pinyons-junipers, goes between the campus and the golf courseææ, down to the Lion's Den then goes back down to town on a narrow social trail which passes a five-foot 3-Dæ'petroglyph' of an Egyptian mummy and ends at the site of our new handicap-accessible home AND our present house next door where everyone is welcome for snacks. Park anywhere between the start and finish point.

Title: NM Badlands Hike
Description: Hike one way throughæLybrook, NM badlands.æ The car trip is long (about 2 hours), but the hike through some rarely visited badlands is rewarding. Expect no trails, some scrambling, plenty of unique landforms, a few hoodoos, no water, moderate pace stopping wherever.æ

Title: SO! Semi-Annual Highway Clean UP Day
Description: Come join other SO members as we clean up our two stretches of Highway 550. Imagine the interesting things you might find _ you may be the one to find a $20 bill this time! Coffee and donuts served in the parking area across from the Hermosa Conoco station.

Title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
Description: This isæa nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread.ææWeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32ndæSt., 32ndæto Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries.æFrom Bread, weÍll take Florida Rd.-15thæSt. to Rotary Park where weÍll rejoin the Animas Trail and return to Home Depot.æææWeÍll leave Home Depot promptly at designated start time.ææHelmets required. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.

Title: Smelter Mountains
Description: We will hike to the towers on SmelteræMtnfrom the trailhead off CR210 behind the Lake Nighthorse pumping station.ææThere is ample parking at the trailhead.
Other Info: Trail difficult if not impossible for small dogs

Title: Mountain Bike Phil's World
Description: Ride several challenging single-track loops onætrailæsystem near Cortez.ææMust have mountain bike with suspension and strong riding skills.ææBring a lunch.ææ
Other Info: Must have mountain bike with suspension and strong riding skills

Title: Hike Haflin Creek Trail
Description: This is classified a hard hike due to the elevation gain.ææHike on a well-established trail with wonderful views of the Animas Valley to the west.

Title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
Description: This isæa nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread.ææWeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32ndæSt., 32ndæto Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries.æFrom Bread, weÍll take Florida Rd.-15thæSt. to Rotary Park where weÍll rejoin the Animas Trail and return to Home Depot.æææWeÍll leave Home Depot promptly at designated start time.ææHelmets required. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.

Title: Three Springs to Grandview Trail
Description: The hike begins at the electrical generator in back of parking lot in the area of Spinal Group offices behind the hospital.ææWe will hike to the intersection with Grandview Trail and a little beyond.

Title: Overend Mt. Park
Description: We will explore DurangoÍs backyard by completing a big loop, including an ascent of the Hogback. All onætrailæbut some parts will be very steep on loose, slippery soil (especially the Hogback). We will set a brisk pace to get in shape for the coming hiking season.
